In this session we will be discussing from the 43rd verse of the 9th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The prayers are over. Now Suta Goswami who is narrating this whole incident to the sage Sunaimisharanya, he is speaking now.
Suta Uvacha Krishna Evam Bhagavati Manovag Drishti Vritti Bhihi

The meaning of this verse is Suta Goswami said,
Thus Bhishma Deva merged himself in the Supersoul, Lord Sri Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead,
with his mind, speech, sight and actions, and thus he became silent and his breathing stilled.
So this is the verse that is describing Bhishma Deva has quit his body in Krishna consciousness.
Because his mind, his speech, his sight and actions are all completely absorbed in Krishna.
So Srila Prabhupada says in the purport,
This verse,
The stage attained by Bhishma Deva while quitting his material body is called Nirvikalpa Samadhi.
This is a technical term.
What is the meaning of this term Nirvikalpa Samadhi?
That is also explained by Srila Prabhupada.
Nirvikalpa Samadhi, it is called Nirvikalpa Samadhi because he, that is Bhishma Deva,
merged himself into thinking of the Lord and his mind into remembering,
remembering his different activities.
He chanted the glories of the Lord, that is his speech.
And by his sight, he began to see the Lord personally present before him.
And thus, all his activities became concentrated upon the Lord without deviation.
Samadhi means total absorption.
Samadhi means total absorption.
Total absorption of the mind, of the thinking, that is the mind, activity of the mind,
the speech, and the sight, and the very self.
So, thinking, remembering, glorifying, and seeing,
in all these ways,
Bhishma was totally absorbed in thought of Krishna.
This is the highest stage of perfection, this total absorption.

So this is the highest perfection to be attained and it is possible for anyone provided one practices devotional service.
Now devotional service itself, how is it performed?
So Srila Prabhupada says based on the explanation in the seventh canto of the Bhagavatam.
The devotional service of the Lord Krishna.
The devotional service of the Lord consists of nine principles of service activities.
Devotional service is not something idle.
Simply sitting and doing nothing. No.
Devotional service. Bhakti means devotional service.
So it consists of service activities.
Activities rendered while having a service attitude.
I want to serve Krishna to please him.
I want to serve Krishna in a loving attitude.
And these nine principles of service activities are described in the Bhagavatam seventh canto as.
Number one. Hearing. Hearing about Krishna. Shravanam.
Number two. Chanting. Kirtanam.
Number three. Remembering.
Remembering in Sanskrit it is called Smaranam.
Number four. Serving the lotus feet of Krishna.
Padashevanam.
Number five. Worshipping.
Archanam.
Deity worship. Specifically Deity worship.
Number six. Praying. Vandanam.
Offering prayers. Just like Bhishma did.
He was remembering Krishna's pastimes.
He was praying. Offering prayers.
He was chanting the glories of Krishna.
And like that he was engaged in all possible ways in service activities before quitting his body.
Totally absorbed in that.
So number seven. Executing the orders.
It's called Dasyam.
Dasyam.
A servant is specially meant for simply carrying out the orders of the master.
Just like Hanuman.
Whatever Rama ordered, Hanuman simply carried out that order.
So that is Dasyam.
Then eighth one of the list of nine service activities.
Eighth one is fraternizing. Sakhyam.
Acting as a rendering service rather.
As a friend of the Lord.
Friend of Lord Krishna. Just like Arjuna.
Rendering service as a friend of Krishna.
And the final one, ninth one.
Fully surrendering. Atma Nivedanam.
Total self surrender.
Total self surrender. Bali Maharaj.
Each one of these, we have an ideal described in the Bhagavatam.
Any one of them, any one of the nine or all of them are equally competent to award the desired result.
That is the highest perfection of total absorption of oneself in the Supreme Lord Krishna.
But they require to be practiced persistently
under the guidance of an expert devotee of the Lord.
Who is that expert devotee of the Lord?
The bona fide spiritual master.
So the bona fide spiritual master gives guidance, gives instructions, helps the disciple
to actually practice
one or more of these nine items, nine principles of service activities rendered for Krishna by a devotee.
